s.text: I submit that this oversight suggests either that Foer isn't as informed on the subject as he appears to be, or that his politics are showing.
The source for greatness is the individual player.
In "Boycott Nike and Reebok," Robert Wright wants shoe companies to sign players who will help inner-city kids conform their conduct to the expectations of a suburban job interview.
The 1995 match is documented at the Chinook Web site and in a recent book by Jonathan Schaeffer on the Chinook project.
